page.title: 14Ecology - Footpaths
page.content: All the districts of Hyndburn are connected by footpaths. From Church Kirk a path goes to Plowtalgh Farm and on the edge of Dunkenhalgh Park to the A678 road. The path continues across the road to Mercer Park. The River Hyndburn is in sight most of the way. A little way up the hill on the A678 towards Rishton a path goes through the hamlet of Tottleworth to Gt. Harwood. Between the Leeds-Liverpool Canal at Rishton, Parsonage and Dean Clough Reservoirs there is a large network of paths. Some of these are included in a walk called 'Hyndburn Clog', recently devised by John Allen of the N.E. Lancs Ramblers Association. Anyone completing the 31 mile walk in 14 hours is awarded a certificate.
